column4: Isn't update-java-alternatives supposed to set JAVA_HOME and JDK_HOME env vars?
Know that. But these things should be taken care of by some install or update script, shouldn't they?
i guess they could, im just used to editting conf files so I wouldnt know
ou could spend hours ttrying to find a gui to do something you already know how to do in a conf file
seems like it is just down for me. But why. Everything else is working and DNS does resolve correctly.
maybe your provider isplaying with their wires
there are options, just try a few see which you like
keep it simple, what makes the most sense?
vmware, virtualbox and qemu all are good
As Xen is paravitualized, it might make the most sense for linux on linux?!
all are fine, if you think that is better then go for it
